abstract: Federal prosecutors unveil 35-count indictment against 15 Chinese nationals who stand accused of complex conspiracy to cheat college entrance examinations and gain student visas; scheme involved fake passports and test-taking imposters, largely in Pittsburgh area.
lead_paragraph: The indictment sketches a scheme in which individuals are accused of paying impostors using fake Chinese passports to take college entrance exams at testing sites in the Pittsburgh area.

headline.main: 15 Chinese Accused of Using Test-Taking Impostors for College Entrance Exams
headline.print_headline: 15 Chinese Accused of Using Test-Taking Impostors for College Entrance Exams

snippet: The indictment sketches a scheme in which individuals are accused of paying impostors using fake Chinese passports to take college entrance exams at testing sites in the Pittsburgh area.
